text:
- Hello, and a very warm
welcome to all of you.

Today I have the privilege
to bring to you insights
from one of the most exciting businesses
in the financial services space: Protium.
Protium is a tech-enabled lender

who's helping micro and
small SMBs get access

to credit faster to manage
both their working capital,
as well as their CapEx needs.
So without further ado,

let me introduce
Padmanabhan Balasubramanian,
partner at Protium Finance Limited
to join us for the discussion.
Welcome, Paddy.

- Thank you. Jasjeet,
and the team in Amazon.
It's a privilege to be here.
- What are the key challenges you
and your team are tackling

as you work towards providing
easy access to credit
for the micro and small businesses?
- Jasjeet, to set the context,

India is a place where MSMEs
drive the growth of the country

and providing capital is, in
some way, a direct reflection

of trying to power the
growth of the country.

So the way we define in
Protium an MSME is an entity,

which is either a self-owned
business generating revenues
of about 50 lakh Indian rupees
to about 5 to 10 crore Indian rupees.

And the challenges they
face now and in the past,
and I think it'll continue for a while,
is access to capital,
several ways of access to capital
because they are either not accessible
through digital footprint,
or they have physical assets
that needs to be used as collateral.

And we in Protium believe the
challenges that they face,
whether it's in working capital needs
or in the CapEx needs
can be solved by using technology

and our physical presence
to fuel India's growth.
- In such a broad spectrum,

strong risk management's
gonna be super important
for running a successful business,

especially when you are
out there extending credit
to as yet an underserved population.
And you managed to do that
while keeping your trade losses low.
So what's the secret sauce?
How do you guys do this?
- Technology plays a key role
in how we think about risk management.
India is at a path where data is available
in multiple sources,

and the digital
infrastructure of the country
is evolving very fast.

This infrastructure allows
us to capture the data

about the customer in a
much more granular way,
whether it is through bureau,

through bank statements, through
GSTs, through financials,
and other alternate data

that allows us to personify
the risk of a customer
in a more granular way

than what people were
able to do five years ago.
So we have a risk management practice

that spawns from writing
a customer algorithmically
to a highly automated risk system,

all of it built in one
single platform in AWS.
- How is it that you've really gone ahead
and tapped into this part of technology
to power your business?

- You can think of the
technology problem here
as a data processing problem.

So we need to be able to
process data instantly

to come at a decision on
say a 10,000 rupee loan.

And we need to process
enormous amount of data

and triangulate a lot of
information in a large loan.

So our technology infrastructure
is highly scalable,

is very componentized so that
we can break these components
and use it in multiple places.

Often, we consider them
as data processing units
in secure environments.
- What is the role that AWS has played
with you as you've grown your business?
- In this day and age,
if you're starting a business
and it has digital components,

being in the cloud I
think is a no-brainer,
it's the only choice.
It used to take enormous effort and time

to build a large monolithic
system for lending business

and that too at the scale
at which we are operating.
Cloud has democratized that

by allowing us to make
investments periodically,
build businesses on top of each other,

and build a highly scalable
and secure business.

So what matters to us the
most, it's time to market,

it's our ability to
scale the business fast,
it's an ability to secure and store data,

and it has the ability to
create perimeters of access.

In all of this, we found
a whole host of tools
that we could adopt in AWS,
and constantly interact with the team
to review the architecture.
So we have built this day one in AWS

and have scaled it over
the last three years.
- It's great to hear that.

The overarching statement
in there from Paddy
is cloud is no longer a choice,

it's the default option
for all small businesses.

Thanks for those
wonderful insights, Paddy.
It's been a pleasure talking to you.

- Thank you very much for
the opportunity, Jasjeet
and the team,

and hoping to have a great
partnership in coming years.
